description: An act of traveling from one place to another.
A large natural elevation of the earth's surface.
A person living near or next door to the speaker.
A place where books are kept.
Able to accept or tolerate delays without getting angry.
A complex of runways and buildings for the takeoff and landing of aircraft.
A place where bread and cakes are made or sold.
A musical performance given in public.
An instrument for writing or drawing, consisting of a thin stick of graphite or a similar substance.
A person who teaches, especially in a school.
The state of the atmosphere at a particular place and time.
A structure with a roof and walls, such as a house, school, store, or factory.
A structure carrying a road, path, or railroad across a river, road, or other obstacles.
A round plane figure whose boundary consists of points equidistant from the center.
Kind and pleasant.
A piece of ground, often near a house, used for growing flowers, fruit, or vegetables.
A long walk, especially in the country or wilderness.
A piece of land surrounded by water.
The method of human communication, either spoken or written.
A reflective surface, now typically of glass coated with a metal amalgam, that reflects a clear image.
The phenomena of the physical world collectively, including plants, animals, the landscape, and other features.
A very large expanse of sea.
A painting, drawing, photograph, or other image.
A sentence worded or expressed so as to elicit information.
A meteorological phenomenon that is caused by reflection, refraction and dispersion of light in water droplets resulting in a spectrum of light appearing in the sky.
A place on a public transport route where vehicles regularly stop so that passengers can get on or off.
Make a journey, typically of some length or abroad.
All existing matter and space considered as a whole; the cosmos.
An act of defeating an enemy or opponent in a battle, game, or other competition.
The coldest season of the year.
